website_summaries.verdict: Go cordless, and quiet, with this power sweeper that clears debris from hard surfaces such as driveways, decks, garages, and sidewalks.
pros: Works best for hard surfaces such as driveways, decks, and garages
Powerful motor churns out up to 130 mph
Uses a 20V MAX 1.5Ah Lithium Ion battery
Battery holds charge up to 18 months
Compatible with other 20V MAX System power tools from this brand
cons: No leaf collection function on this sweeper

customer_reviews.title: Great little patio sweeper
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little sweeper. I use this to blow off my patio under a pergola. It is also good pressure for blowing leaves off of gravel/mulch landscaping and not move the landscaping material. This is not appropriate for blowing leaves in grass ( which is why it's called a sweeper). Great price on a 20V cordless product.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Love this blower. It easily moves my small leaves and grass clippings for my weekly lawn work. I no longer have to use a broom or water hose to get rid of the grass clippings. Saves so much time. I'd recommend buying an extra battery if you have or plan on buying multiple black and decker units. I have the hedge trimmer and weed eater which are great products too. It's nice having all black and decker lawn tools since the batteries are interchangeable. But one battery will work perfectly fine for just the blower for weekly lawn work so no need in getting an extra battery if you have an average size lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just right for light work on my deck
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, light weight, powerful enough for light work, good battery life and price. Posted a picture of how I used an old hose rack to park it on my deck for easy use
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Hate It
customer_reviews.text: If you need to blow out candles on a birthday cake, this is your blower, anything more it's a total waste of money. Battery life is as low as the air it blows. Total waste of money. One star is being very kind for this "blower"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned LSW221 which has very weak output for LSW321 for ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned LSW221 which has very weak output for LSW321 for $10 more. The LSW321 has a boost button which adds about 40% to the output flow over this unit making it acceptable for light duty. I still have an electric powered unit for heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Dean P Wichert

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs like patios and decks
customer_reviews.text: I waited almost 2 months to post a review of this blower. We purchased it specifically to blow off pine needles off our deck and walkway which is about 300 square feet. It works great, you're not going to clean up your whole yard with this thing but for simple chores like this where you have a small area and you don't want the hassle of getting cords out we can blow off the deck in a few minutes. It works 3 times before we have to recharge the battery. Picture is looking straight up from our deck so you can see what we deal with and this little guy works well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Another great investment for me from Black & Decker. It is not super strong or powerful as gas power. It is lightweight and small. This is easy to start, no need to pull string or mixed gas. Just put in the battery, turn on, and blow leaves away. Perfect for my patio and driveway. Make sure everything is dry, don't use after a rainfall. Don't expect this to clean up your entire yard or blow up leaves in the fall. After one year, the battery and equipment still in good shape. One battery to rule them all.
customer_reviews.author: Thy Vu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light sweeping!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I ordered this unit. I was pleasantly surprised at how powerful this blower is for light work. I cleared the patio, front walkways and driveway with no loss of power and plenty of blowing power to do the job. Charger works perfectly, quickly. Once charged, manual recommends leaving it in the charger so it is always ready, which is what I do. I was concerned about it getting too warm. Once charged, it basically shuts off and shows a green light to indicate it is ready for use. Great lightweight blower for quick cleanups.
customer_reviews.author: S. Guy

customer_reviews.title: So far disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This just arrived, the box looks like it survived a hurricane. The product looks like it’s been used already. I’m going to charge the battery and see if it even works at all. So far very disappointed so.. only one star.
customer_reviews.author: KAREY LUNGHOFER

customer_reviews.title: Serious doubts about 130mph
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most is that it's a convenient little 'sweeper'. What I like the least is the 130MPH rating. I use a gas-powered Stihl that I'm pretty sure was rated at 180. This 'sweeper' at 130 sounded worth a try. Since I have no way of measuring its flow, I can't call the rating an outright lie. There's also the possibility that it's a 'flow vs pressure' thing. If so, the rating is still misleading because most people don't understand these dynamics. I gave it to my wife who uses it for the porches and deck and asked her to rate it. Thus, the three stars. It's pretty much useless for any serious leaf or after mowing work.
customer_reviews.author: Letter Addict

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this BD unit because it was cordless and light and had a battery that was interchangeable with the BD cordless drill I bought at the same time. I have a electric leaf blower but in my old age is too heavy and not easy for me to use. My new cordless is only 2v and not as powerful as my electric. However it is adequate because I am going to use my yard man also. I can do cleanup with this lightweight blower inbtween. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Straight to the point review.
customer_reviews.text: This blower is not extremely powerful... That being said. It is excellent for shop use... ...Light weight yard work... ... and any other small jobs you might need a blower for. The battery does not last for a long time however and if you need it for prolonged use you will need extra batteries. I have a electric blower that plugs in and it is way more powerful, I thought I would get rid of it when I got this one but ended up keeping it for heavier jobs. Go ahead and buy one If you have the extra money and extra storage space. (which isn't a big issues because it is rather small)
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sweeper!
customer_reviews.text: I just love my B&D 20 volts Max Sweeper! So light and easy to use. Just snap in the battery, and turn it on. Very light and maneuverable. I can hold it with one hand, yet it blows hard enough to move a lot of debris. Not ment for huge leaves piles... perfect for leaves on deck or porch... sawdust in shop.... spiderwebs in the rafters. No need to move the deck furniture. Cleans dust and dead bugs off those high shelves without climbing a ladder, be careful if you have light objects on shelf. Also works on grass clippings and leaves on walkway!
customer_reviews.author: PIlar

customer_reviews.title: Very small in size, looks like a kids model.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize how small this unit was going to be. I thought I was buying a leaf blower as that is what I entered my search as and was very surprised at what arrived. That’s my fault, I should have payed closer attention and did more research. I used it this evening to blow leaves at 40°F and got 15 minutes out of a 2.0 amp battery with continuous use. I also had a 3 amp battery that lasted a bit longer. It is very quiet and light weight. It’ll blow leaves which is better than raking but it’s too small and weak for the size of my yard.
customer_reviews.author: AKrider

customer_reviews.title: Pretty crappy when you have to keep charging it just ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery at full charge does not last more than 5 minutes. Pretty crappy when you have to keep charging it just to blow dust off patio.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Blower
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I can use it with one hand as I pull my oxygen on rollers behind me. I can blow off my patio and my walkway before it gives out. I’m 76 years old. However, the battery is very difficult to get it to click into place. It’s also very difficult to get the battery to release. I have to get someone else to do those two things for me. That’s very aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: MawMaw PawPaw Bowden in GA

customer_reviews.title: Great sweeper, blows leaves, but leaves accent rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I love this B&D cordless blower! It is perfect for my needs. I have white landscape accent rocks lining my walkways with A LOT of tree debris. My regular wired leaf blower would scatter the rocks and debris all over the place. This unit has enough power to dislodge the leaves and debris without picking up the accent rocks. It is more of a sweeper than a full blown blower, but has enough power for leaf blowing on patio, driveways, etc. It’s lightweight and easy to maneuver around potted plants (without blowing all the potting soil out of the pot!). Charged fast, less than an hour. Lasted about 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Belle

customer_reviews.title: convenient for quick clean ups on the patio or in the garage
customer_reviews.text: This sweeper is super convenient for quick clean ups on the patio or in the garage. The battery is good for about 20 minutes (i have n extra and just change them out). Note, this is a "sweeper" which is designed for clean ups on concrete and hard surfaces. This is not intended as a "blower" for gardens or grass. Also, it works better with dry surfaces
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and cordless- very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy! Light weight. Just what I need to blow the dust, dirt, and light leaves that accumulate on my side walk and front/back porches, and driveway. I love that I don’t have to worry with a long cord. I bought an extra battery- great decision- to have on hand because the battery gives you about 15-20 minutes of use. Interchangeable with my black and decker weed eater. If you want something lightweight with no cord- this is a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for light work
customer_reviews.text: The blower was delivered a day early and charged the battery which didn't take long. This is the first cordless blower I've owned and I was really surprised at how well it works. I used to blow the grass off the riding mower, my garage, the carport and drive way. It does a really good job. It took me probably 10 minutes to do all of that and it held the charge. It is not meant for heavy duty work so keep that in mind. It is light weight and hassle free. No gass or oil to mess with. Definitely recommend this for doing light work.
customer_reviews.author: 3D shooter

customer_reviews.title: Very low power
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to blow off the walkway and deck after mowing without having to drag out the extension cord. Was not looking to blow leaves so accepted the lower power of a cordless. They say it generates 130mph and I assume that's accurate but the volume of air is very low. It does work but do have to make multiple passes where the corded blower did it in one pass. Imagine 130mph air through a drinking straw. Its not going to move much. Its not that bad but you get the point. Thought about returning it but haven't found one that looks like it would be any better.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Good - very light
customer_reviews.text: Light, but not really powerful. If you're looking for a leaf blower to clear your yard, this isn't it. It's good for grass clippings on the walk, blowing dirt/dust out of garage, and quick and easy tools clean up (lawn mower/saws etc.). Battery life is good, the volume of air is good and most importantly for me, it's very convenient (pull it off the wall and use it). I have multiple tools with the same batteries so always have a couple fully charged when it does die, but it holds the charge a long time and has a decent run time even with the smaller 1.5Ah batteries.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tolliver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for blowing off driveway
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I was hoping it would do. It is perfect for blowing grass clippings and small debris on surfaces like your driveway. Not a leafblower by any means, but a perfect light weight and maneuverable blower for a lot of applications! I also use it to blow dust and junk out of my garage. I have a plug in leaf blower that is great for high power work like blowing leaves, but it is a real hassle to set up after each lawn mowing session. This battery powered blower just perfectly fits the bill to clean up afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all! Great for quick cleanups.
customer_reviews.text: I hate sweeping. We have a high power, commercial grade blower, but it is too heavy for me and I don't even know how to use it. My husband uses that one for the heavy duty property cleanups. This sweeper blower is perfect for me to quickly blow off my patios and deck. It is extremely convenient and lightweight. It cleans up dust and some stray leaves to keep things neat. Again, this is NOT for heavy duty cleanups. Keep it charged and ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: drefinnej

customer_reviews.title: Limited but quite handy at times.
customer_reviews.text: Just remember, it's called a "sweeper" and not a "Blower" for a reason. This is fairly small, lightweight and handy for a quick sweep of loose leaves on a deck or patio or in a garage or your camper but it is just not all that powerful. The battery life is rather limited at perhaps 10 minutes before it starts to reduce in power and maybe 15 or 20 minutes at most which led me to buy an extra battery. So, it is handy as a secondary device, but completely deficient as a primary blower. I would recommend it with those limitations clearly understood. I have and can heartily recommend the small Echo backpack blower for serious work.
customer_reviews.author: Freudian

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and a big blow
customer_reviews.text: This little device blows off my garage apron and home entry like a champ. It is very light weight, not very noisy, and delivers a punch. It is so much faster to use this device than sweeping the old fashioned way. One battery will last about 15 minutes. Fortunately I have three and this will complete all my needs at one time. The company should give buyers the option of purchasing more batteries along with the blower. Fortunately I have a "covey" of Black and Decker machines and each shares the same battery.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F. Cheney

customer_reviews.title: Easy, handy, very portable - no cords!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Lightweight and very easy to use. Battery lasts. I was visiting a friend and saw her husband using it almost daily on her patio when we were going to entertain. It was as easy but far more efficient than using a broom but as spontaneous. No cords. First thing I did when I got home was order. Now we keep our driveway and patio neat between yard cutting/blowing which previously was the only time they were cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Bev Kirkman

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasted under 15 min. Not as advertised. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasted only about 15 min when NEW w full charge. I tried again lasted even less time. Low power at full blow. Wasnt as advertised at all.
customer_reviews.author: Magic Moon

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed too !
customer_reviews.text: Can’t comment its drying yet. But right out of the box I used it , for the exact reason I bought it. To blow my sidewalks and porch off after mowings and edging. Didn’t even have to charge the battery. It blew the dust and grass off No problem. So I used it to blow some dust and spider webs off. Worked so good in the front yard went to the back patio. But that only lasted about 5 minutes then I took the battery from my Black &Decker weed eater and finished off .
customer_reviews.author: Motoxroc

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to accompany the Black and Decker Weed Eater I bought (so they could share batteries) and I am not disappointed. I am replacing all my corded lawn tools and love the Black and Decker series. This sweeper does exactly what it is supposed to do but please don't get me wrong, it's not as powerful as a corded blower but for what I use it for (grass, leaves, etc) it doesn't need to be. The battery lasts quite a while and the inter-changeability is great! I also bought the hedge trimmer to go with the other two tools but that is a different review! I endorse this for all average home owners!
customer_reviews.author: EgolfClan

customer_reviews.title: Eaaier To Start Than My Gas Blower
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this for my wife. She hates my gas powered blower and said that if she had a lighter blower, she would keep our porch and deck blown clean. So when I use this blower, I have found that it has about half the blowing power of my gas unit. It works, but it takes about twice as long to get the job done. It has my gas blower beat hands down when it comes to noise, weight, maneuverability and ease of starting. And I have told my wife that seeing is believing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sweeper not a blower
customer_reviews.text: Item received was opened and used. No original plastic wrap on the blower and battery lasted 15 seconds. I did use my spare battery and was able to test it. It is a SWEEPER and did well on dried leaves. It did not blow my bark away, which was the reason I chose this. I also tried it on my patio. No problem. However, when the area was wet, the wet leaves, papers and pin needles will not budge. I do recommend this as a sweeper only. Use it on dried surfaces and dried leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Tkk

customer_reviews.title: For light dirt and leaves... not very strong
customer_reviews.text: Despite some of the reviews, I decide to chance it and get this. Although, it is light and cordless, it truly is for blowing light dirt and leaves. Not good for blowing a lot of leaves. More to maintain an area. I have a small condo patio and it works great if u maintain the patio often and blow light dirt and some leaves. During fall when the trees start to shed, I will need to definitely pull out another blower to blow more leaves. This would be more worth it if it was $25 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously Short Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is fewer than 10 minutes. Cannot even handle the very tiny back patio of mine. Will be returning this product. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Knicky Fountain

customer_reviews.title: Remember, it's a battery powered blower
customer_reviews.text: I got caught up again with buying a lesser expensive blower to replace my previous battery powered blower. I'm done with battery powered blowers. If you use it to blow some dust or small leaves around occasionally, then it will be fine. But I recommend a small gas blower instead. I can't recommend which brand, but I am pretty sure that a gas blower will be a much better choice in the long run. The battery blowers are just modified toys.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Electric Sweeper (not leaf blower)', packaging was open though
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you know what you are buying if you are getting this. It is an electric sweeper and not a leaf blower. As others have said, it isn't super powerful, but it is plenty powerful enough to blow grass clippings off the sidewalk and clean the patios. I also use it to quickly blow out the garage too. If you think you are going to do a fall leaf cleanup with this, then you will be disappointed. The only downside is the packaging was open when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: steve wiant

customer_reviews.title: It's little in many ways
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really do like it. I just needed something to quickly and easily blow off my large deck. I have an electric BIG blower but it's a pain to get out and plug in for little jobs. This little blower was on sale and it does the job. Would I like more power? Of course I would. Overall, it does what I need it to do at a good price. Also, I have a weed eater that uses the same battery so now I have 2 interchangeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Friend

customer_reviews.title: Convenient little sweeper
customer_reviews.text: It's not too powerful, but I got it for sweeping the sidewalk on the way out to the mailbox and the decks around the house, and it works fine for that, but it's not for doing the yard in the fall. Great for the small jobs that you don't want to drag a cord out for. I'm soon going to try it out blowing water off the truck or the bike after a wash!
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Rider

customer_reviews.title: Light weight. Effective for dust and grass clippings
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for blowing dust off my porch and grass trimmings off my steps and sidewalks. It is so light weight it doesn’t tire me out to use it. I don’t think this would work well for a whole yard full of leaves, but it’s not a leaf blower, it is a duster. It’s so much easier to use than using a broom.I don’t think this would work well for a whole yard full of leaves, but it’s not a leaf blower, it is a duster. It’s so much easier to use than using a broom
customer_reviews.author: rita Glenn gray

customer_reviews.title: Holds a charge for up to 18 months?  Not in your wildest dreams.
customer_reviews.text: I copied the following from the listing: Air speed up to 130 Miles per hour Operates on a 20V MAX 1.5 Ampere hour Lithium Ion battery that holds its charge for up to 18 months First: Of course I cannot measure wind speed, but 130 MPH certainly does not seem to be what this device is producing. Second: The battery did not hold a charge for but about 1/2 hour - not the 18 (Eighteen) months as reflected in the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Book lover

customer_reviews.title: 18 wheeler trucker says it works
customer_reviews.text: I drive an 18 wheeler with its 53 foot van trailer. This Sweeper does a good job blowing out the trailer of light debris and light dirt. Fast too. Will not blow out heavier things. You would normally pick those things up by hand and bag them anyway. Battery power is safe than a deadly carbon monoxide producing motor. This B&D works for me. I do carry a janitors broom if bigger problems arise. Question above: It does not dry anything. Blower velocity I rate it as: Good.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I use this for cleaning up the grass clippings from the sidewalk and driveway. It does a great job for that. As others have stated, it's not a "gas leaf blower" equivalent. It works for small clean up jobs. I have the 20V trimmer and a 20V drill. The batteries are all interchangeable so it makes it really convenient for me. I got fed up with trying to start my gas blower after the winter only to find it wouldn't start. In the time it takes to start that I am able to complete the sweeping with this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: TwoDogNight

customer_reviews.title: Found  new use!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this blower, with its moderate power, perfect for sweeping driveway and Kool-Deck. But I've also found a quite unique use for it. My 99-year-old baby grand piano had accumulated dust under the strings for decades, which I could never adequately extricate. On a whim, I tried the sweeper -- and voila! All the dust is gone! (Of course, I then had to dust the entire house afterwards!) As other reviewers have noted, the battery doesn't hold a charge for long, so when not in use, we always keep it on the charger.
customer_reviews.author: R WARNAS

customer_reviews.title: Environmentally friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blower because I no longer wanted to pollute the air with my gas-powered blower. To tell the truth, this one does not have half the power of my old one and it takes longer to clean up my yard. But it is clean and quiet! I used to feel guilty about disturbing my neighbors with the loud noise of my Stihl. My new one is very quiet and I doubt my neighbors can even hear it. I have a large yard and lots of oak trees. For the average homeowner with a normal-sized tract home, this blower would be just fine, I would expect.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Lafferty

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I do not have any large trees and therefore do not need a "leaf-blower". What I do need is something to "sweep-out" my garage and patios. This is exactly what it does. It is very lightweight and compact. It has enough power to move the debris from the areas I need. In addition, since I also have a similar 20V B & D line trimmer the batteries are interchangeable (now I have two). Very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ckc

customer_reviews.title: Works well, light and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Old Black and Decker blower died after 11 years. Ordered this Black and Decker as replacement. Much lighter, less noise and clears the grass trimmings . Also use it to blow the debris that blows on the open porch. Have a stone floor in my garage. The leaves that blow in are easily removed and the blower doesn’t blow the stone. Better than the old one and I would buy it again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Schlegel

customer_reviews.title: Charger makes a very long day to complete one yard!!!
customer_reviews.text: It would be great if B & D put in their 45 minute charger. They mess you up on the charger!!! It is like this is a good deal but if you have to wait 3.75 to 7.5 hours for it to charge then it is not a good deal on this product. Nothing on the box tells you which charger you are buying or tells what charging time it has! Mine has the 3.75 hour charger in it! I found out which one I have by holding a light up close to the small raised print on the inside face of the charger to find out that mine is 3.75 hours per charge!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Just okay force
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace a corded blower that died after several years. This one uses the same battery as my B+D cordless drill so I now have two interchangeable batteries. This is appropriately labeled as only a sweeper because it has no where close to the force of a regular blower. Works for my patio deck and driveway but not really strong enough to blow leaves and debris off the grass. It’s fine if your application is just for hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: CO Diver

customer_reviews.title: BJs lack enthusiasm
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I was expecting, it is battery operated. It does blow air, just not very forcefully. For my use, after mowing I use a leaf blower to blow the clippings back into the grass. In the past I've used a corded model, which I wouldn't expect to stand up to a gas-powered one, but it works. I would attribute that same amount of step-down (from gas to corded) from corded to this. I can still blow the clippings back into the lawn but it takes 3 or 4 times more passes. Still, at least Im not dragging a cord around.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not worth thr money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very low power blower. For something this soft of a force of air it shoyld be around $19.99, not $60. So yes if you need just a light blower, this would be fine but do you really want to pay $60 for it? My husband joked that he could blow harder than this. We are returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Not very powerful
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed it wasn't a little more powerful. Didn't expect a hurricane from a battery powered blower, but did expect a bit more. Works fine for blowing fresh cut grass off sidewalks, etc. Wouldn't even attempt to blow leaves with this unless they were dry, on top of the grass, and not much quantity. Gets between 5-10 minutes continuous blow time with new batteries. Am sure it will be half that in two years time. I would advise buying the fast charger and an extra battery if you will need it more than the run time I listed. Bought it as much for matching batteries to cordless trimmer that I do like.
customer_reviews.author: V Dubs

customer_reviews.title: Great as a sweeper, not as a blower
customer_reviews.text: There is a very good reason why B&D calls this a "Sweeper" instead of a "Blower". If you're needing to sweep dust, light dirt, or dried grass off the driveway... then this is perfect. It's lightweight and easy to carry around. The battery doesn't seem to last more than 30 minutes, though. If you need to blow leaves across the yard or some other heavier item, then this sweeper likely won't have enough power to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Rod M

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: Works so well for such a small electric motor. I like that the batteries and charges are interchangeable between various Black & Decker devices, so I never run out of power. As long it it is used on relatively small areas it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: D R

customer_reviews.title: Very light and strong enough to sweep away grass and light debris
customer_reviews.text: Stronger than I thought it would be. When I received it, I thought to myself 'this thing is so small' but once I gave it a go, it worked just as expected. Very light and strong enough to 'sweep' the grass right off of my driveway after a mowing, even wet grass. Battery life was long enough to complete the job, about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: crow1214

customer_reviews.title: Great Cordless Sweeper for Small Jobs!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an alternative to a corded blower / sweeper I have been using for years to clean my patio and walkways. It works great and has enough power to quickly and easily sweep leaves and other debris from patio and walkways. Charge only lasts about 20 minutes, but since sweep time is only 5 - 10 minutes I can get job done twice on 1 charge. I also purchased a second battery and charger so I have a charged battery always available. Great unit for the money for small jobs!
customer_reviews.author: Tom A.

customer_reviews.title: lightweiight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful lightweight blower. It works wonders to blow off grass and leaves off porches, decks, and driveways I have also used it to blow out my garage. The battery does not last long, so you may need to have 2 batteries if you have a lot of work to do. It is not as loud as other blowers. I highly recommend if you need a small blower that won't weigh you down.
customer_reviews.author: catlady

customer_reviews.title: Great for basic home use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for your garden, front yard, porch - small jobs. Lightweight and not deafening. Easy for my 76 y/o mom to handle. The battery life is short - about 15 minutes - which is comparable to most battery operated blowers on the market. But it comes with a charger and you can always get an extra battery. Great thing is the battery interchanges with other power tools. Bottom line, this is perfect for the home and for use in short intervals just to help get debris away or collect it into one general area for sweeping/raking.
customer_reviews.author: mar

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight works okay on concrete areas
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight . Works okay to blow leaves and grass from our driveway but I don’t think it would work well in grass on heavy leaves. I got this mainly for the drive and sidewalks because I had shoulder surgery and needed something light . I would say it’s good for a homeowner with a small area to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Already not working!
customer_reviews.text: Well, made this purchase May 4th and already not working! The on/off button quit working! Of course it was only returnable until June 3rd ... I am so mad! UPDATE:! After posting this review, Black + Decker contacted me and actually sent me a a new blower complete with batterry and charger! Knowing that Black + Decker want their customers to be satisfied, I would not hesitate to make another purchase from them!
customer_reviews.author: saddleup357

customer_reviews.title: Convient but VERY lite duty!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars solely for its convients always ready to go but only for light duty jobs such as blowing off the deck, tables, sidewalk, garage floor etc. the box says up to 130 mpg but I am pretty sure you can take the 1 off the 130. The battery drains quickly which is not a problem with multiple batteries but if you are looking for a blower to move a pile of leaves this one is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: WINESHAMAN

customer_reviews.title: Good blower from bad order
customer_reviews.text: Ordered an open box from amazon warehouse that was lost in delivery and came with missing tube. I ordered a replacement tube and works fine for blowing patio, deck, garage, and sidewalks. Its strong enough to blow acorns and loose gravel too. I like not having to sweep with a broom and save water and not getting deck wet from not using a hose. The battery does run down after 15 minutes of full use but there’s a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No charger plug included
customer_reviews.text: Warning! This does not come with the charger plug as advertised. The box does not show it as one of the contents included and it is not. You can buy a charger plug separate for about $25 but at the present it’s not on Prime so you have to wait about a month if you want to use this. I tried to bring this to Amazons attention but they were not able to understand and fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things I’ve done for myself!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this blower. I’m a clean freak so I use it every day for my patio and front door area. It’s lightweight, the battery will last through use on my driveway, back patio and my kitchen patio. It’s easy to recharge, too, no cumbersome cords to drag out and rewind. It’s not as powerful as my big corded blower so I couldn’t clean the yard with it but it’s perfect for quick clean ups. I actually keep the blower in my coat closet for quick and easy access.
customer_reviews.author: NormaJean

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Blower
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a small area. Our apartment patio and the breezeway by the front door are often filled with leaves or mowing debris. This lightweight blower does a good job of clearing those. Not really powerful enough to dry things and directional blowing is a bit difficult sometimes. I can't lift heavy items due to medical reasons. It is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Culp-Hook

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Love this blower. Had a plug in blower for years and years, and still do, but what a hassle. For quick jobs on a hard surface (sidewalk, driveway, deck, etc) this is ideal. For leaves in grass, forget it. But they don't claim that. As advertised. Love this, would buy it again. I also have a B+D weed eater with the exact same battery, and now I can interchange them. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Low Power CFM Blower, fast consumption of Battery, about 15 Minuets of use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blower because it's battery is compatible with my other B&D 20V MAX Lithium Cordless devices. This blower is small and compact and does a good enough job on my 60x100 foot lot. Don't expect high blower cfm from such a compact unit. What I am disappointed about is the battery consumption. It must have a large amperage draw because the same 20 volt battery will run my B&D trimmer for 30 minuets. If you purchase this blower get an extra battery and charger and you will be better off.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and perfect for me...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to clean off my backporch (instead of trying to get the broom behind stationary objects) and to blow the grass off my driveway after I cut the lawn.... this is lightweight, cordless and I was able to blow away all the straw and dirt without too much hassle... I'd did a great job blowing off the backporch and I have no doubt that it will totally blow the grass away with no problem as well...
customer_reviews.author: sheena

customer_reviews.title: So cute and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for our porches, and garage as our backpack leaf blower is just too powerful and will knock things down. It is pretty darn power. I will not have to Sweep these areas with a broom. Last about 20-25 minutes fully charged. My 9 year old loves blowing off areas with this- it’s light weight! Put has a nice blow considering it’s size.
customer_reviews.author: Tosha Pack

customer_reviews.title: Sweeper’s OK;  Customer Service A+
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sweeper to replace another on which the motor became annoyingly loud. After a few months, though, the on/off switch was clearly defective. I had to bang it on a hard surface to activate it. Turning off was easy, but I knew the switch would completely break soon. I contacted B&D who referred me to a service center. Took the sweeper there and was told they would process a replacement. To my surprise, UPS delivered a new one 2 days later. Hopefully this one will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalGuy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't blow well, lacks power.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this model to replace my old Black and Decker 20v LSW20B Bare Max sweeper that had a fan bearing going out after 4 years of intermittent use. This one is quieter but is significantly less powerful, almost to the point of being useless. If you have a small area and all the pine needles, grass cuttings and leaves are nice and dry this will suffice, but if you want something with a little oomph, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H. Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: A light blow but useful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to match my weed eater.... glad to have compatible batteries... but this unit has minimal power... about 1/3 the power of my corded B&Der... I will only use this for my front & back porch. Very light, very handy... very weak... UPDATE: HAD SEVERAL WEEKS... battery won't hold a charge... unit runs for 5min... I have a second battery but most wouldn't > UNACCEPTABLE
customer_reviews.author: dralexy

customer_reviews.title: Good light duty blower
customer_reviews.text: Love this little blower. I have about 20 willow oak trees. This blower has the right air velocity to blow the small leaves into a pile to bag for curb pick up. Battery lasts 10 minutes when in constant use. I have 4 batteries so I rotate them. Takes an hour to recharge. Comfortable weight. Velocity also good for sweeping the garage and driveway without creating a dust cloud.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Dori

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight blower
customer_reviews.text: It’s lightweight and works well. Not the most powerful gadget, but I really just need it to blow yard debris off my driveway and patio periodically. I had other Black and Decker products (edger, still) with interchangeable batteries. It’s nice how they standardized, so the more products of theirs you have the more extra batteries you’ll likely have.
customer_reviews.author: bacinci

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight cordless leaf sweeper works well
customer_reviews.text: I agree with most people who have reviewed this cordless sweeper. It works fine for blowing off pine straw and debris from my porch and driveway. It wouldn't be very effective in the yard. I plan to use it on the roof next. The small battery pack is much lighter than the old style batteries that would not hold a charge if left unplugged. So far I am pleased with this B&D product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Houser

customer_reviews.title: Lite but lacks power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at our campsite, to blow grass clippings off and away from objects that I didn't want them on. It works, BUT, it's very wimpy in it's attempt to move any grass or debris. It will be OoooKaaay for what I need it for but it lacks real power, more like a kids toy than a working tool. The batteries take a long time to charge and don't last long when I need them. For the price it's a weak, almost useless excuse for a blower. I could buy a more powerful blower but this was expensive enough... I guess the old adage "you get what you pay for" is definitely true in this situation.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Read carefully!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Read carefully!!! I'd do just as well if I took my blow dryer outside and used that. 130mph?? No way... And they have 20% restocking fee, plus you have to pay for shipping to return even tho they are selling thru prime so it's cheaper to keeper!!! Do not recommend unless you're using it only on concrete for about 15 minutes that's all the battery will last.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER LSW221 light weight handy easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very light weight leaf blower. It is powerful enough for small jobs on smooth surfaces like decks and driveways. It will not be good in thick grass or with twigs/branches but it makes up for this less power than a plug or gas version in its connivence and ease of use. Get two extra batteries as it will operate continuously for about 15 minutes per charge. Its also fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Good for light sweeping
customer_reviews.text: I have a 0.35 acre lot. So, my blowing needs are primarily a short driveway, walkway, and road. It works fine for a quick sweep of dry grass and dirt following a mow. It isn’t going to blow away much of anything that might be slightly attached. It is super light and very basic, almost looks like a toy. After three months of use for about once per week, it has been worth the price for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Works okay for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is very light. It works pretty decent for a battery powered unit. The battery lasted about 10-12 minutes. I bought this because it was a 20v system thinking I could use it with all my other standard 20v batteries. It DOES NOT fit up with the standard 20v system. This is the reason I gave it 4 stars. Otherwise I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Love this blower
customer_reviews.text: I dont know how i existed without this! Just love it! The blower is lightweight, comfortable size, and battery convenience! I have a dirty evergreen tree near my patio which wore me out cleaning and sweeping nearly daily! With this , just snap in the battery and go- it takes me longer to get off the sofa than Clean the debris. If anything happened to it i would immediately replace it with exact same thing! I very strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Vance

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a powerful blower. It is for clearing hard surfaces as they clearly indicate.
customer_reviews.text: This blower is more like a toy than a serious tool. It is light, has a decent lithium battery and just barely pushes enough air to work for the specific "sweeping" application I need: Clear the sidewalks and driveway. Clean off the river rock. garden beds and blow off the garage floor. I have a plug in blower with a lot more power when needed but for most of the work I do this little thing is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: GSD

customer_reviews.title: Not a long battery life
customer_reviews.text: Love being cord free with battery operated equipment, however, this blower does not have a lot of juice and should only be used for small jobs. The blower drains the battery quick too. I can’t even make it around the whole house without it dying. If you buy this, I strongly recommend purchasing an additional battery and expect that you may be able to get a small front porch and your sidewalks in before the batter dies.
customer_reviews.author: StepStone

customer_reviews.title: Super weak, no where near advertised 130 mph
customer_reviews.text: This is slightly more powerful than a hair dryer...I bought this to dry my car, and it's completely useless for that application. I have found some use in blowing dust and debris off the patio so it's found some use, but overall this is a pretty worthless product...spend more money and get something with more power if you want to do anything more than move dust...don't let the brand name fool you, this is is not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Roshon

customer_reviews.title: Good for a variety of chores
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a blower, but it does a great job sweeping the garage of leaves and dust, drying off my motorcycle or truck after a wash, clearing a small deck or patio, blowing the grass clippings off the sidewalk, blowing off the rider when you are done cutting or many other small chores. If you have the B&D cordless 20v string trimmer the batteries are interchangeable, doubling your work time on either device. This is a great alternative to my regular gas and electric blowers.
customer_reviews.author: Mrmr

customer_reviews.title: Good for light stuff but certainly not meant to push lots of leaves
customer_reviews.text: I bought this instead of a fan to use on a photo set. I figured you'd need to stand back a ways but the air current generated by this requires you to be close. I had it in my car and thought I'd use it to help dry my car but it was ineffective. Good for push some dry leaves off the deck, but not much more.
customer_reviews.author: Webpager

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this blower periodically for a year blowing out garage and porches until on/off switch stopped moving. After taking apart I noticed plastic was interfering with switch moving properly. The only way I could get it to work was to remove switch and hold my finger down on button inside switch cavity. I’m chalking it up as a design flaw because tools should last longer then a year of light use. I’m going to look for something more dependable like a Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Toml

customer_reviews.title: My weakest B&D product!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at how weak this blower is! I have owned a B&D 20v blower for 4 years or so and just love it! This blower is a disappointment! I use it in my pole barn but any large debris beyond a few leaves doesn’t get moved far! I own a pole saw, hedge trimmer, weed wacker, tiller, and blower, all B&D 20V products ordered thru Amazon and absolutely swear by them!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: not for yard work
customer_reviews.text: Come on guys, you've got to be kidding, it looks like a child's toy! I guess black and decker will slap their name on anything just like bell and Howell. its really tiny and might move some cat hair but do not buy this for yard work. I bought it to dry my car. I will update in future, but I'm optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: OBDEWL'L. X

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought a gas blower
customer_reviews.text: I knew going in that this thing would not blow really hard. I happened to have a drill that would use the same battery, buying the battery alone was only slightly less than purchasing this which includes a battery and charger. Now, does it move some light leaves and (dry) grass off of my driveway? Kinda, I would say "good enough" for the price. But, I personally would rather have a gas blower that can be found for a similar price....
customer_reviews.author: J. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a different battery powered leaf blower but as expected it is not going to be as powerful as gas powered or electric items. However this blower is not very powerful and would only be appropriate for clearing off small hard surfaced areas. I would only recommend this product for someone looking for a lightweight blower to maybe clear off a deck or patio area. Also my battery with a full charge will only last around 20 mins before weakening it’s power and needing charged again. And it takes 4+hrs to charge a dead battery.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Utterly Worthless to an Astonishing Degree
customer_reviews.text: This thing does nothing. It’s blows dust. Period. It was totally unable to blow short grass clippings off a patio. Even positioning the wand so the air would blow under the clippings. A TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY. The only thing worth keeping is the battery & charger because those actually work with some other B&D gizmos we have. Don’t make the same mistake we did.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for smaller jobs. Will blow off patios and smaller leaf jobs. Do not buy for large jobs as blowing capacity is not that great. Like this blower because of 1) light weight. 2) Ease of battery attachment and dethatching. 3) Ease of charging 4) Staying power of battery for each job.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Hennenfent

customer_reviews.title: Only issues is how long the battery lasts
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it says, it’s a sweeper, not a blower. It works perfect to sweep my walk after a mow. My only reason for a 4 star instead of 5 is because this thing blows through a fully charged 20v battery in less than 20 minutes so it’s not great for a larger property unless you have multiple batteries. I bought this because I have the battery powered trimmer and I wanted an extra battery so I figured I’d buy the sweeper so that I’d have an extra battery. Now I feel like I still need an extra battery because the blower leaves no left over battery power for my trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Smaller and weaker then I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Should have realized all the people who model these are dwarfs. The size wasn't the problem as much as the poor battery life and was pretty weak if anything clumped together. I like how it takes the same battery as my cordless drill set but it eats through them really quickly. I would get something more powerful next time even if it needs a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Goldblum

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It’s fine for what I use it for, which is to sweep our driveway of fallen oak leaves. It would be nice if it had even more power, but it’s lightweight and does the job. When there are lots of leaves, I use my 200mph corded leaf blower. But, it’s more convenient to use this battery powered unit most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Rod J

customer_reviews.title: Great as a Quick Cleaner-upper
customer_reviews.text: This blower is definitely light-weight, maneuverable, and quick and easy to use. It is by no means heavy-duty. Great for small job, and quick cleanups or 'dusting', but no heavy-duty large volume work. Great to blow out the car, dust sidewalks, decks, and entrance-ways -- but not full-yard leaf blowing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: No charging station sent back twice!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as it showed it came with a. Battery, charging station and the blower itself. The charging station was not included. When I went to return it, I was advised to call Black and Decker for a replacement part. After doing that I was told that this item did NOT come with a charging station. However it shows it on the picture describing he product. Sent it back Update: received the same item without the battery charger again. This is false advertising as it clearly shows a charger to plug into the wall on the Amazon page. I am done - this is going back for good
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Sweeper--Handy for Light Jobs
customer_reviews.text: Not a blower. It is, as advertised, a lightweight sweeper. Handy and small, this sweeper is capable of blowing leaves, flower droppings, etc., from my two large patios, front porch, and front walkway. It is quiet and quickly available when I don't want to break out my large and heavy corded blower.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Light duty sidewalk sweeper, low air volume
customer_reviews.text: This model is cheaper, less powerful than the model it replaced. Very disappointed, would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Montana

customer_reviews.title: Great SWEEPER to use in place of a broom!
customer_reviews.text: Great sweeper! SWEEPER! I use this to blow grass clippings from trimming and light debris from my garage in place of using a broom. It has worked great for those jobs. I wouldn't use it to blow leaves in my back yard... That's what my LEAF BLOWER is for. But my leaf blower is overkill and too cumbersome for broom jobs. This sweeper has made those small jobs a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Essig

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V Max Lithium Sweeper (LSW221)
product_meta.description: The BLACK+DECKER LSW221 20V MAX Lithium Cordless Sweeper is ideal for clearing driveways, sidewalks, decks, garages and other hard surfaces of leaves, grass clippings, and other lawn debris. With air speed up to 130 MPH, this sweeper easily clears debris from hard surfaces like driveways, decks, and garages. It offers a lightweight design of only 3.7 lbs., and the low noise design allows for quiet operation. This unit operates on a 20V MAX Lithium Ion 1.5Ah battery that holds its charge for up to 18 months. Part of the 20V MAX System 1 System. Endless Tasks. Power for your Style. Includes: (1) LSW221 20V MAX Lithium Ion Cordless Sweeper, (1) LBXR20 20V MAX Lithium Ion Battery , (1) Charger, (1) Blow Tube.
